sources.name: UN – Population Division (Fertility) – 2015 revision
sources.description:
Description:
Data published by United Nations – Population Division. Published in the World Population Prospects; 2015 revision.
Data publisher's source –
Linkhttp://esa.un.org/unpd/wpp/Download/Standard/Fertility/
Retrieved19 May 2016
Additional information
Linkhttp://esa.un.org/unpd/wpp/Download/Standard/Fertility/
Retrieved19 May 2016
The data for a particular refers to the 5 years preceding that year. E.g. 2015 refers to 2010-2015 in the original data.

variables.name: UN – Population Division (Fertility) – 2015 revision
variables.description: Total Fertility Rate. (The average number of children a hypothetical cohort of women would have at the end of their reproductive period if they were subject during their whole lives to the fertility rates of a given period and if they were not subject to
variables.coverage: Global by country and world region (world regions are as defined by the source (the UN))
